page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: {St.Michael's Preparatory School} The headmaster, Mr Tame, said he enjoyed his job mostly for the teaching. He dislikes paperwork because he has to stay in his office. St.Michaels has an aim to prepare boys for their life in the future.The school has a great history. It used to be one of King Charles I houses, dating back to the early sixteenth century. The school has girls from 3-7 years and boys from 3-14 years. {St.John The Baptist Secondary School} The headmaster is Mr McCarthy. He said that to be a headmaster you need to get on well with the pupils and their parents. You need to persuade the staff to do things right and last of all you need to have an understanding family. He also said that two days are never the same. The school has 50 teachers and 759 pupils.
